Uses of Class
suncertify.db.DBAccessException

  • Packages that use DBAccessException 
    Package Description
    suncertify.db  

    • Uses of DBAccessException in suncertify.db

      Methods in suncertify.db that throw DBAccessException 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int Data.create(java.lang.String[] data)
      This method adds a new record to the database.
      static DBMain DataAccessObjectFactory.createDataAccessObject()
      Method for obtaining the reference to the data access object.
      void Data.delete(int recNo)
      This method logically deletes the record uniquely identified by the integer record number argument from the database.
      int[] Data.find(java.lang.String[] criteria)
      This method does a search of the database for records matching the specified criteria.
      static DBMain Data.getInstance()
      This is a class method for retrieving the refrence to the only instance of this class.
      boolean Data.isLocked(int recNo)
      This method indicates whether a record is locked or not.
      void Data.lock(int recNo)
      This method logically locks a record, a record must be locked before it can be updated or deleted.
      private boolean DBRecord.matchesRate(java.lang.String value)
      This determines if the parameter String matches the rate attribute of this record.
      private boolean DBRecord.matchesSize(java.lang.String value)
      This determines if the parameter String matches the size attribute of this record.
      java.lang.String[] Data.read(int recNo)
      This method reads from the database a record with the number in the input parameter.
      void Data.unlock(int recNo)
      This method logically unlocks a record.
      void Data.update(int recNo, java.lang.String[] data)
      This method updates the record uniquely identified by the record number parameter with the values in the array of String object parameter.

      This is the constructor for this class.
